description: From bio- (“life”) +‎ Ancient Greek ἕρμα (hérma, “sunken rock, reef”).

entries.meaning: (geology) A mass of rock constructed from the remains of marine organisms such as coral or algae, especially in a mound or dome shape.
examples: Bioherms are built quickly. Over the course of a century, one will rise by up to 7 metres, and expand across the sea floor, following the contours and topology of what already exists.
